meanings.definition: To bend the head or body forward in greeting or respect.
meanings.sent1: She will bow to the queen when she meets her.
meanings.sent2: The performer will bow after the show.
meanings.sent3: He decided to bow dramatically to his friends as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to bow in the wind's powerful embrace.
meanings.sent5: The students were taught to bow politely before entering the dojo.

meanings.definition: A weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood with a taut string.
meanings.sent1: Robin Hood used a bow to shoot arrows at his enemies.
meanings.sent2: The archer carefully aimed his bow at the target.
meanings.sent3: The toy bow made of plastic was no match for the real ones.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like arrows shot from a bow, hitting their mark.
meanings.sent5: The bow was beautifully crafted with intricate designs etched into the wood.

meanings.definition: A knot tied with two loops and two loose ends, used to tie shoelaces or ribbons.
meanings.sent1: She tied her shoelaces with a neat bow.
meanings.sent2: The gift was wrapped with a shiny bow on top.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the bow on the present.
meanings.sent4: The bow in her hair added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: He carefully tied the bow, making sure it was perfectly symmetrical.

meanings.definition: The front part of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood at the bow of the ship, gazing out at the sea.
meanings.sent2: The waves crashed against the bow as the ship sailed through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the bow, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The bow cut through the water gracefully, leaving a trail behind.
meanings.sent5: The bow of the ship was adorned with a figurehead of a mythical creature.
